Class AeCompensationHandler

java.lang.Object

Direct Known Subclasses:
AeCoordinatorCompensationHandler, AeImplicitCompensationHandler
public class AeCompensationHandler
extends AeFCTHandler

Models the compensateHandler that is part of a scope or process.

Field Detail

mCallback

private IAeCompensationCallback mCallback
Reference back to the object that invoked the compensation handler

mCompInfo

private AeCompInfo mCompInfo
reference to the current set of compensation information. If a scope was executed in a loop then it'll likely be compensated for each iteration through the loop. The compensate activity will call into the handler to execute the compensation behavior once for each time the scope reported its execution as complete. Each time through, the comp info object will be set in place so the comp handler will have access to the correct variable snapshot

Method Detail

isEnableCoordinatedActivityCompensation

protected boolean isEnableCoordinatedActivityCompensation()
Explicit compensation handlers run only the CompInfo objects specified by Compensate activities. After running all of the activities with in this handler, any remaining coordinatated activites (invokes) must also be (implicitly) compensated. This method returns true so that the coordinated activities are also compensated.

Specified by:
isEnableCoordinatedActivityCompensation in class AeFCTHandler
Returns:
Returns true if the coordinated activities (invokes) should also be compensated after executing the normal list of CompInfo object.
